intro: Chelonanthera gibbosa, commonly known as the warty bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, inflated, warty calyx that resembles a helmet, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Chelonanthera gibbosa is a member of the Campanulaceae family, which includes many other bellflowers.
